@prateekm Agreed. Personally, I'd prefer names be a required parameter as well for now. It keeps the API simple instead of having 4 different variants of `partitionby`. Also, "change your name when you re-deploy with a different topology" is a much easier story to explain.

We can certainly add another variant with auto-generated names later.

Pushed (force) a new commit after rebasing from master. Addressed 2/3 of the comments but left the `openDB` one. Could rename existing `openDB` to something else and make it private, and then rename `openTelemetrizedDB` to `openDB` - would that work?
Thanks for the suggestion - pushed a new commit

@janeklb Are these test failures related to your changes? Otherwise looks good to me, I'll merge these.
```
:samza-kv-rocksdb_2.11:testPicked up _JAVA_OPTIONS: -Xmx2048m -Xms512m
testFlush FAILED
    org.apache.samza.SamzaException: Error opening RocksDB store dbStore at location /tmp, received the following exception from RocksDB org.rocksdb.RocksDBException: "
        at org.apache.samza.storage.kv.RocksDbKeyValueStore$.openDB(RocksDbKeyValueStore.scala:99)
        at org.apache.samza.storage.kv.TestRocksDbKeyValueStore.testFlush(TestRocksDbKeyValueStore.scala:73)
testIteratorWithRemoval FAILED
    org.apache.samza.SamzaException: Error opening RocksDB store dbStore at location /tmp, received the following exception from RocksDB org.rocksdb.RocksDBException: "
        at org.apache.samza.storage.kv.RocksDbKeyValueStore$.openDB(RocksDbKeyValueStore.scala:99)
        at org.apache.samza.storage.kv.TestRocksDbKeyValueStore.testIteratorWithRemoval(TestRocksDbKeyValueStore.scala:100)
testTTL FAILED
    org.apache.samza.SamzaException: Error opening RocksDB store someStore at location /tmp, received the following exception from RocksDB org.rocksdb.RocksDBException: "
        at org.apache.samza.storage.kv.RocksDbKeyValueStore$.openDB(RocksDbKeyValueStore.scala:99)

5 tests completed, 3 failed
:samza-kv-rocksdb_2.11:test FAILED
```
I think they're unrelated.. but I did see that `testTTL` failed a few times locally, though it was intermittent.
this functionality was put in as a part of another PR.

Made the operator IDs required for stateful operators after offline discussion with @nickpan47 and @cpettitt-linkedin.
@sborya this was intentional. Why does this need to be not final?
Also don't think this should be required with the latest master since it compiles fine for me. Are you seeing issues compiling with Scala 2.10?
@xinyuiscool It's not just closing the store twice, but any operation on the store after a close. I'll sync with you offline to understand the use case you mentioned.
Eww look at that commit history. Closing this PR in favor of #339
@shanthoosh

Talked to @xinyuiscool offline. The reader writer lock is for changing the state of the store (i.e. closing it), not for writing (put/flush) to it. get/put/flush/delete all acquire the read lock, so contention shouldn't be a huge issue.

.... walk of shame.... I made a mistake
@shanthoosh @vjagadish1989 please take a look
cc. @vjagadish1989 to see if this overlaps with our earlier discussion about stopping SSPIterator on EOS.

@prateekm @lhaiesp @xinyuiscool 

Can we keep `emptySSPBySystem` and `endOfStreamSSPs` separate concepts? (instead of removing an end of stream SSP from the set of empty SSPs)

Atleast the semantic meaning of emptySSPs == the set of SSPs that we have no buffered messages for, and endOfStreamSSPs == the set of SSPs that are at EOS is maintained.

If the only intention is to prevent that SSP from being polled we can add a check during poll to filter out end of stream SSPs. In other words, an SSP is polled iff. both these conditions are true:
1. If we don't have buffered messages for it
2. If we have not reached end of stream

@vjagadish1989 : right, the logic an be simplified by adding a simple check in poll().

@lhaiesp : can we make this change instead?

@prateekm for review.

cc @vjagadish1989 @dxichen @jmakes for review
@srinipunuru I don't think that it is a good idea to have the official doc pointing to an un-official repo. We need to bring in the samza-sql-tools in Samza repo.
@xinyuiscool @nickpan47 Can you guys take a look?
@jmakes @nickpan47 @prateekm for review.
If you have a tutorial, we can have a section here linking it on how to run a simple app that reads from Kinesis and writes to Kafka.

@vjagadish The way i see SamzaSqlConsole is a samza app. Samza App depends on all the systems that samza app supports. So with that in mind, SamzaSqlConsole taking a dependency on samza-azure is similar to a SamzaApp taking a dependency on Azure.

Now considering that SamzaSQLConsole is an App and Samza-sql module is a library. I don't think it's good idea to merge them at all.

@shanthoosh zkJobCoordinator already calls readJobModel with valid list of containerIds. In readJobModel, we just inject this list of containerIds into config. This effort is to build the processor list which is absent for Yarn and PassthruJC. ZkJC already builds the processor list. Let me know if I'm missing something.
Thanks for the review @sborya  !
cc @vjagadish1989 for review

@srinipunuru Thanks for pointing out! I did not realize that `SamzaSqlConsole` is a demo application. 

I wanted to clarify on my earlier comment, I was trying to ensure

1. User code need not have to depend on `samza-tools` in any form, and should only take a dependency on `samza-sql`.
2. The scope of `samza-tools` is tools for testing/demo, convenience scripts for produce/consume from various systems etc..

Could you please add description into either the ticket or the PR (or both) with what you are trying to achieve. 
Thanks!
@sborya Sure! I have updated the description for both the pull request and the JIRA ticket.

Hey @fredji97 ,
Thanks for this PR. While I'm +1 to your idea, I'm trying to ensure that the open-source codebase doesn't remain in a state where some `Config` classes follow inheritance while others follow composition for a long period of time. Ideally, I would love to make all changes in one-shot throughout the Samza code-base. It need not have to be a single PR but would be nice if you have all necessary PRs ready and if they can be merged in quick succession. cc: @prateekm @nickpan47
@fredji97 : Please can you resolve the conflict and we should be good to merge this.
